title: New York City Health-Care Worker Has Severe Adverse Reaction to Covid-19 Vaccine
sub_head: Employee suffered anaphylaxis after getting Pfizer-BioNTech injection, but is in stable condition
body:
Only one of the 30,000 people who have so far received the Covid-19 vaccine in New York City had a severe adverse reaction to the shot, city officials said Wednesday.
A health-care worker in the city suffered anaphylaxis after getting the Pfizer Inc. -BioNTech SE injection. The worker, who wasn’t identified, is in stable condition, officials said.
A spokesman for the city’s health department didn’t provide further information about the worker. The department is working with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to track other side effects of the vaccine, officials said.
“We’ll continue to follow up on those events and make sure that we’re taking it seriously,” Dave Chokshi, the city’s health commissioner, said at a news conference Wednesday. He added that the severe adverse reaction was uncommon and that the vaccines are very safe overall.
As of Dec. 18, there have been six reports of allergic reactions to the Pfizer-BioNTech shot in the U.S., according to the CDC. More than 272,000 doses of the vaccine had been administered by that time.
